Generation II.Gold: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.
Generation II.Silver: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temp. is over 1100 degrees , so don't underestimate it.
Generation II.Crystal: It naturally spits an 1100-degree flame. It is said when many appear, it heralds a volcanic eruption.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It is found in volcanic craters. Its body temp. is over 1100 degrees, so don't underestimate it. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Magby 's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pok é mon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
Generation III.Sapphire: Magby 's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pok é mon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
Generation III.Emerald: If a Magby is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.
Generation III.FireRed: It is found in volcanic craters. Its body heat exceeds 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit , so don't underestimate it.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.

Generation IV.Diamond: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees F . It is healthy if it is breathing yellow flames.

Generation VII.Sun: Many of these Pokémon can be seen in areas with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F .
Generation VII.Moon: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When flames drip from its nose, that means it has a cold. Have it lie down for a nice rest in some magma.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its body temperature is always around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit . If Magby falls into a small- enough pond, the whole thing will dry up.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes. At the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma, resting and recovering from the day's fatigue.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit . It is healthy if it is exhaling yellow flames.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its body temperature is around 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit . It is healthy if it is exhaling yellow flames.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, sparks leak from its mouth and nostrils.
Generation IX.Violet: Magma-like blood circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, raising its body temperature as high as 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit .
